intro: Streptanthus arizonicus, commonly known as the Arizona stinkcup, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Streptanthus arizonicus is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
